title: New: Diners – How To Live / Good Friends
content:
Despite hailing from Phoenix, Arizona, there’s something noticeably British about ‘adult pop’ three piece Diners.

Sure, they’ve got the slightly twee American accents and Vampire Weekend inspired jagged guitar lines, yet there’s a jovial grounding to Diners that is fairly apparent in their music, despite there only being four minutes of it so far. Both tracks are rather frantic, energetic numbers, not taking themselves too seriously, whilst showing their ability to write catchy two minute pop songs. Good Friends showcases the Tokyo Police Club-esque slick vocals, with lead singer Tyler Broderick recounting ‘oh I live for the stories that you tell, I live for these nights oh I live for hell’. Check out both tracks below.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
